DOC.brief_summary: The aim study show safety efficacy SeQuent® Please ( Drug Eluting Balloon DEB ) vs. commonly use Drug Eluting Stents treatment small vessel disease side branch pressure wire guide percutaneous coronary intervention .
DOC.brief_title: Pressure-wire Guided PTCA : Drug Eluting Stent Versus Drug Eluting Balloon ( WinDEB Study )
DOC.detailed_description: This study randomize , prospective , multi-center , efficacy study DES control group assess 6-month loss FFR patient treat `` matrix coat paclitaxel-eluting PTCA-balloon catheter '' SeQuent® Please commonly use DES small vessel de novo side branch lesion . 100 patient study total two equivalent treatment group DEB & DES 50 patient .
DOC.criteria: Patients least 18 year age . Patients stable angina pectoris ( CCS class 13 ) unstable angina pectoris ( Braunwald class 12 , AC ) document ischemia document silent ischemia Patients must agree undergo angiographic 6month clinical followup 12 36 month . De novo coronary lesion include side branch native coronary artery ( reference vessel ≥ 2.0 ≤ 3.0 mm , lesion length ≤ 25 mm angiographically document ) Diameter stenosis pre procedure must either ≥ 70 % ≥ 50 % ischemia correspond target lesion document either exercise stress ECG , stress echocardiography , scintigraphy , MRT , suspect base angina pectoris . Fractional Flow Reserve ( FFR ) must less equal 0.75 . Patients life expectancy le 12 month Patients treat one DES last 12 month would allow 3month dual antiplatelet therapy patient randomize DEB treatment group . Patients oblige dual antiplatelet aggregation therapy 3 month follow study inclusion Patients acute ( < 24 h ) recent ( 48 hour ) myocardial infarction Patients severe congestive heart failure severe heart failure NYHA IV severe valvular heart disease Patients demonstrate clinical sign cardiogenic shock time procedure ( systolic blood pressure le 80 mmHg require inotropic support , IABP and/or fluid challenge ) DES treat lesion ( ) last 12 month . Thrombus burden ( STEMI , NSTEMI ) and/or total occlusion culprit segment Insegment stenosis native vessel within 5 mm adjacent stent
DOC.keyword: Drug Eluting Stent , Drug Eluting Balloon , Fractional Flow Reserve , DES , DEB , FFR
